qas.question: The state's economy ranks in what place in the country Mexico
What was the GDP of the state as of 2011?
Which sector was the largest portion of the economy?
Which sector was the second largest?
The state received how much in remittances from the U.S. in 2011?

context: The state has the <a0_0>12th-largest<a0_0/> state economy in Mexico, accounting for 2.7% of the country’s GDP. Chihuahua has the fifth highest manufacturing GDP in Mexico and ranks second for the most factories funded by foreign investment in the country. As of 2011[update], the state had an estimated <a1_0>396 billion pesos<a1_0/> (31.1 billion dollars) of annual GDP. According to official federal statistical studies, the <a2_0>service sector<a2_0/> accounted for the largest portion of the state economy at 59.28%; <a3_0>the manufacturing and industrial sector<a3_0/> is estimated to account for 34.36% of the state's GDP, with the agricultural sector accounting for 6.36% of the state's GDP. Manufacturing sector was the principal foreign investment in the state followed by the mining sector. In 2011, the state received approximately <a4_0>884 million dollars<a4_0/> in remittances from the United States, which was 4.5% of all remittances from the United States to Mexico.
